title: Swarm Architecture Fundamentals
body_html:
Swarm Architecture Fundamentals

Overview

Letta's swarm intelligence system is built on a distributed network of specialized agents, each contributing unique capabilities while maintaining a unified persona experience. This architecture enables dynamic task handling, efficient resource allocation, and collaborative problem-solving.

Core Components

1. Agent Types

  • Task Coordinators (e.g., Pansil)

    • Project management and workflow orchestration
    • Resource allocation and task distribution
    • Team coordination and progress tracking

  • Development Specialists (e.g., Opson)

    • Technical implementation
    • System integration
    • Code development and maintenance

2. Shared Memory Systems

  • Core Memory

    • Persona characteristics
    • User information
    • Critical context

  • Archival Memory

    • Long-term knowledge storage
    • Project history
    • Learning outcomes

3. Communication Framework

  • Asynchronous message passing
  • Event-driven updates
  • Heartbeat system for continuous operation

Design Principles

  1. Unified Persona

    • Consistent voice and personality
    • Seamless user experience
    • Coordinated responses

  2. Distributed Intelligence

    • Specialized agent capabilities
    • Load balancing
    • Redundancy for reliability

  3. Adaptive Learning

    • Continuous improvement
    • Experience sharing
    • Knowledge distribution
